book.name: Resource Folders - How to Guide
book.intro:
Resource Folders ....

The ATEP Writing Teams have used Folders extensively throughout the courses. 

The Folders will contain a collection of information that the writer's wanted to make available to the course teacher.  IN this case, you will see that the writer has provided additional information for students.  In this case, the documents were cited in the previous Lessons.

The above documents can be accessed by clicking on the links.

chapter.title: Folders - How to Guide
chapter.content:
Folders are a valuable resource.  They allow the Writing Team to provide a wide range of easily accessed supplementary resources for the Students and Teacher, or as we will see, in some cases, for the Teacher alone.

In the example above, the folder is intended for student usage ... when the link is clicked, the following will be seen ...

To access any of the documents, the student simply clicks on the links.

In this example, the documents are cited in the preceding lessons, and are intended to provide extension activities for students progressing more rapidly through the course.

chapter.title: For Teachers Eyes Only!
chapter.content:
In some cases, the Writers have used folders to provide further guidance for the Teacher ... You will notice in the example below that the Folder is "hidden" from students, but is accessible to the teacher.

Clicking on the link opens up a lot of additional information for the Teacher.

It is anticipated that the Teacher Notes and Resources Section of each topic will contain Standards Correlation and other such information.
